item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 不要让美联储的噪音淹没来自中国的信号
item.description:
日本化日趋严重。同时，"新兴市场 "也该退休了

Japanification is looming ever larger. Meanwhile, it’s time to retire ‘emerging markets’

】

item.title: 台湾 40 亿美元收购战因金融公司出价遭拒而陷入僵局
item.description: 台湾 CTBC 金融控股公司收购规模较小的竞争对手新光金融控股公司的提案被否决后，该公司股价上涨。【原文：Shares of Taiwan’s CTBC Financial Holding Co. gained after its proposal to take over smaller rival Shin Kong Financial Holding Co. was rejected.】

item.title: 香奈儿购买巴黎高档蒙田大道上的建筑
item.description: 香奈儿在巴黎蒙田大道（avenue Montaigne）上买下了一栋大楼，这里是巴黎备受瞩目的购物场所。【原文：Chanel bought a building on avenue Montaigne, a high-profile shopping destination in Paris, as European luxury players swoop in to secure prime real estate for their boutiques.】

item.title: 威兹航空公司告诉长途乘客没有什么是免费的
item.description: 威兹航空控股公司（Wizz Air Holdings Plc）向所有考虑明年飞往沙特阿拉伯的廉价航空公司发出了一条信息：如果您想要装饰品，请自备。【原文：Wizz Air Holdings Plc has a message for anyone considering the budget airline’s seven-hour flight to Saudi Arabia next year: If you want frills, bring your own.】

item.title: 中国芯片股在宣称设备取得突破后大涨
item.description: 在中国宣称在研发国产半导体制造设备方面取得突破性进展后，中国芯片相关股票跳涨，这是中国在克服美国制裁方面迈出的一步。【原文：Chinese chip-related stocks jumped after the nation claimed a breakthrough in the development of homegrown semiconductor-making equipment, a step in overcoming US sanctions.】

item.title: 印度共同基金大举进军新时代 IPO
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 镍电池价格回落后在中国得到推广
item.description: 中国的电动汽车市场正在试探性地挑战向无镍或无钴电池的转变。【原文：China’s electric-vehicle market is offering a tentative challenge to the shift toward batteries with no nickel or cobalt.】

item.title: 台湾公司否认制造黎巴嫩袭击所用传呼机
item.description: 台湾金阿波罗公司否认制造了黎巴嫩各地袭击事件中使用的寻呼机，此前有媒体报道称这家低调的公司是这些设备的供应商。【原文：The Taiwanese company Gold Apollo Co. denied it manufactured the pagers used in attacks across Lebanon, following media reports that identified the low-profile firm as the supplier of the devices.】

item.title: 日本股票销量创 20 年新高，本田和 Asics 抢占市场
item.description: 日本公司向公众出售的股票数量是二十年来最多的，凸显出即使是八月份的股市大跌也没有抑制投资者对新股的需求。【原文：Japanese companies have sold the most shares to the public in two decades, highlighting how not even an August equity rout has damped investor demand for new stocks.】

item.title: 达里奥看到中国的 "现实问题"，保持少量投资
item.description: 桥水联合创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）表示，其家族办公室的投资组合中仍有一小部分投资于中国，但他指出，在经济放缓加深的背景下，中国存在着 "真正的问题"。【原文：Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio said a small part of his family office’s portfolio remains invested in China, but pointed out that there are “real issues” in the country amid a deepening economic slowdown.】

item.title: 内地市场休市后重新开市，中国股市出现波动
item.description: 节假日休市后，在内地市场上市的中国股市努力寻找方向，甩开了香港股市在要求采取重大经济刺激措施的呼声中的涨势。【原文：Chinese stocks listed on mainland markets struggled to find direction after a holiday break, shrugging off the gains in Hong Kong equities amid calls for major economic stimulus.】

item.title: 澳大利亚两家养老金公司计划合并成立 410 亿澳元的基金
item.description: 澳大利亚养老金 Equip Super 和 TelstraSuper 正在探讨合作事宜，这两家公司将成立一个规模达 600 亿澳元（约合 410 亿美元）的基金，这也是养老金行业最新的一家小公司。【原文：Australian pensions Equip Super and TelstraSuper are exploring a tie-up that would create a A$60 billion ($41 billion) fund, the latest of the industry’s smaller players to join forces.】

item.title: 中国央行再次推迟一年期贷款操作
item.description: 中国央行宣布将于9月25日向国内贷款机构注入一年期流动性，这标志着中国央行在全面调整政策工具包的过程中又一次推迟。【原文：China’s central bank announced it will inject one-year liquidity to domestic lenders on Sept. 25, marking another delay amid a broad overhaul of its policy toolkit.】

item.title: 印度摇摇欲坠的电力公司阻碍其能源转型
item.description: 电力工人普拉蒂玛-马利克（Pratima Mallick）在印度东部挨家挨户走访，她的任务只有一个：说服客户交钱。【原文：Electricity worker Pratima Mallick travels door-to-door in eastern India with one mission: to convince customers to pay up.】

item.title: 董事会辞职，Wojcicki "承诺 "将 23andMe 私有化
item.description: 23andMe Holding Co. 联合创始人兼首席执行官安妮-沃西基（Anne Wojcicki）告诉员工，在独立董事会成员辞职后，她仍致力于将这家基因检测公司私有化。【原文：23andMe Holding Co. co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Anne Wojcicki told employees that she remains committed to taking the genetic testing company private following the resignation of its independent board members.】

item.title: 达里奥认为美联储降息四分之一是债权人的 "正确选择
item.description: 布里奇沃特联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）表示，从美国经济的整体情况来看，美联储本周的降息幅度可能较小。【原文：Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio said the overall picture of the US economy probably warrants a smaller interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this week.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长罗杰斯称通胀问题 "仍需努力
item.description: 加拿大央行二号官员表示，即使年度总体价格压力已回到目标水平，决策者仍希望看到核心通胀率取得更大进展。【原文：The Bank of Canada’s No. 2 official said policymakers want to see more progress on core inflation, even with yearly headline price pressures back to target.】

item.title: 美联储减息对亚洲日元和新兴市场影响最大
item.description: 人们普遍预期美联储本周将转向降息，这很可能会支持亚洲新兴市场资产，进一步扩大其近期对日本和芯片股等全球热门股的领先优势。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s widely anticipated pivot to interest-rate cuts this week is likely to bolster emerging Asian market assets, further extending their recent lead over global favorites such as Japan and chip stocks.】

item.title: Animoca 萧泓称香港是可能进行首次公开募股的有力竞争者
item.description: 加密风险投资者和区块链游戏开发商Animoca Brands Corp.董事长萧逸表示，香港是其潜在上市的 "有力竞争者"。【原文：Hong Kong is a “strong contender” for a potential listing of crypto venture investor and blockchain game developer Animoca Brands Corp., its Chairman Yat Siu said.】

item.title: 美联储降息将成为亚洲各国央行的发令枪
item.description: 在经历了两年多的货币痛苦之后，随着美联储将于周三将利率下调四分之一个百分点，亚洲各国央行将得到一些缓解。不过，亚洲地区自身货币政策的道路将从此崎岖不平。【原文：After more than two years of currency pain, Asia’s central banks are in for some relief as the Federal Reserve is set to cut interest rates by a quarter-point Wednesday. The path for the region’s own monetary policy, though, will be bumpy from here.】

item.title: 交易员远离与莫迪有关联的股票，转向防御性股票
item.description: 印度投资者正在回避那些有望从总理纳伦德拉-莫迪的连任中获益的股票，转而投向防御性行业。【原文：Investors in India are shunning stocks that were expected to benefit from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s re-election, and instead piling into defensive sectors.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 与美联储降息预期挂钩的创纪录赌注面临大幅亏损的风险。对在 Archegos 倒闭案中损失惨重的银行的法律审查正在加强。史蒂夫-科恩即将离开交易大厅。【原文：Record wagers tied to the Fed’s expected rate cut risk sharp losses. Legal scrutiny of banks that lost big on the Archegos collapse ramps up. Steve Cohen is stepping away from the trading floor. —Nicole Bullock】

item.title: 中东局势紧张，美国库存成为焦点，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 由于交易商评估了中东日益加剧的紧张局势、好坏参半的美国库存报告以及美联储利率政策的可能走向，石油在收于两周多来的最高点后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after closing at the highest in more than two weeks as traders assessed rising tensions in the Middle East, a mixed US stockpiles report, and the likely course of Federal Reserve interest-rate policy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行将重点关注数字货币批发而非零售
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行表示，鉴于零售版数字货币可能带来的益处不大，但也有潜在的复杂性，因此将重点关注中央银行批发版数字货币的可能用例。【原文：The Reserve Bank of Australia said it will focus on the possible use cases for a wholesale central bank digital currency given the modest likely benefits and potential complications from a retail variant.】

item.title: 纽森表示担心人工智能法案的 "寒蝉效应
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）表示，他担心州议会通过的一项监管新技术的法案可能会对人工智能的发展造成 "寒蝉效应"。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom said he is concerned about a potential “chilling effect” on the development of artificial intelligence posed by a bill to regulate the new technology passed by the state legislature.】

item.title: Bausch Health 借助杰富瑞进行债务再融资，协助分拆上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，博士伦健康公司（Bausch Health Cos.）正在与杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group）合作，探讨对其部分债务进行再融资，以帮助分拆计划已久的博士伦眼科护理公司（Bausch + Lomb）股权。【原文：Bausch Health Cos. is working with Jefferies Financial Group to explore refinancing some of its debt to aid a long-planned spinoff of its stake in the eye-care company Bausch + Lomb, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 市场综述：日本股市将上涨，交易员等待美联储和日本央行的动向
item.description: 在美国基准股市创下新纪录之后，日本股市周三早盘有望上涨。【原文：Stocks in Japan are poised for gains early Wednesday after the US benchmark hit a fresh record ahead of hotly anticipated central bank meetings in both countries.】

item.title: 关于 Nvidia 芯片、人工智能炒作和未来的一切
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）成为全球三大最有价值公司之一，其股价大涨是基于一系列假设。其中一个假设是，由其半导体实现的人工智能应用将成为现代经济的特征。另一个假设是，Nvidia 及其依赖的分包商能够顺利满足对其设备的爆炸性需求。【原文：The blistering stock rally that’s made Nvidia Corp. one of the world’s three most valuable companies is based on a number of assumptions. One is that artificial intelligence applications made possible by its semiconductors will become features of the modern economy. Another is that Nvidia, and the patchwork of subcontractors upon which it relies, can meet the exploding demand for its equipment without a hitch.】

item.title: 掉期价格显示受挫交易商怀疑日本央行的利率信号
item.description: 在日本央行七月董事会会议后受到打击的投资者似乎不愿意接受日本央行最近发出的加息信号，掉期市场认为日本央行今年加息的可能性仅为三分之一。【原文：Investors who were burned in the aftermath of the Bank of Japan’s July board meeting appear unwilling to accept its recent signaling on interest rates, with the swaps market pricing only about a one-in-three chance of a hike this year.】
